Subclasses of Command in commands.display_commands
 class ClearStamps
          Clears all stamps created by user
 class PenColor
          Returns the index of the current pen color.
 class SetBackground
          Sets the background color to a color corresponding to the index of that number in the drop down menu where 0 is the first number.
 class SetPenColor
          Sets the color of the pen to the color corresponding to the position, starting at 0, of the color in the drop down menu.
 class SetPenSize
          Sets the size of the pen to a pixel value which is given as a parameter.
 class SetShape
          Sets the turtle image to the number (starting at 0) corresponding to the image in the drop down turtle image selection menu.
 class SetViewProperties
          Takes care of porting arrays generated from properties file to arraylists for more flexibility.
 class Shape
          Returns the index of the current turtle shape being used.
 class Stamp
          Stamp command to add stamps

Subclasses of Command in commands.multiple_turtles

          Ask command, evaluates command list for turtles that are given as parameters

          AskWith command, evaluates commands given for turtles that satisfy the provided expression

          Extension of tell, has a turtleSet with only the odd turtles as active

Uses of Command in commands.turtle_commands
 

Subclasses of Command in commands.turtle_commands
 class Back
          Takes input pixels, changes x or y values based on the angle orientation of the turtle.
 class Direction
          Direction handles making new states, when a turtle's degree is shifted makeOrienatation must be implemented depending on the direction in which one would like to rotate.
 class Forward
          Takes input pixels, changes x or y values based on the angle orientation of the turtle.
 class Home
          Returns the turtle to the 0,0 coordinate (center of the grid) and resets the orientation of the turtle to the default orientation.
 class Left
          Rotates the turtle left, by shifting the angle by -90 degrees.
 class Movement
          Movement handles making new states when a turtle moves in given direction (forward or backward) and returns the new state of the turtle.
 class Right
          Rotates the turtle left, by shifting the angle by 90 degrees.
 class SetHeading
          Turns the turtle to face an absolute degree given.
 class SetXY
          Moves the turtle to a given set of coordinates x,y on the screen.
 class Towards
          Changes the orientation of the turtle to be facing coordinates x,y as specified.
 class TurtleCommandOneInput

Uses of Command in commands.vcu
 

Subclasses of Command in commands.vcu
 class DoTimes
          Runs the commands for each value specified in the range, i.e., from 0 up to (limit - 1).
 class For
          Runs the commands for each value specified in the range, i.e., from start up to end, going by increment.
 class If
          If expr is not 0, runs the commands given in the list.
 class IfElse
          If expr is not 0, runs the trueCommands given in the first list, otherwise runs the falseCommands given in the second list Returns the value of the final command executed
 class Make
          Assigns the value of expr to variable, creating the variable if necessary Returns expression
 class Repeat
          repeat command, evaluates for the amount of times that an expression evaluates to.
 class To
          Assigns commands given in the second list to commandName using parameters given in first list as variables When commandName is used later in a program, any given values are assigned to variables that can be accessed when the command list is run Returns 1 if command is successfully defined, otherwise 0

Uses of Command in commands.view
 

Subclasses of Command in commands.view
 class ClearScreen
          Clears the view of the turtle's trail and resets the turtle to its home position of 0,0 and returns the direction its facing to default.
 class HideTurtle
          Makes the turtle invisible (0).
 class SetPenDown
          Sets the pen position to down (1) so that the turtle can draw lines as it moves.
 class SetPenUp
          Sets the pen position to be up (0) so that line drawing cannot occur as the turtle moves.
 class ShowTurtle
          Sets the visibility of the turtle to on (1)

          Makes a list of trees by storing their root, loops over all commands tokenized by the parse method, and calls treebuilder, putting the root in an array of roots.
